name: Cheryl Martin
text:
I went for my first experience with acupuncture a few days ago. I was a bit nervous, but had read enough research articles on the benefits to encourage me to try it. Foti is very knowledgeable about his practice, and great about talking you through the procedures. We had an in-depth consultation at the beginning, and he also suggested different supplements and dietary changes for my injury/lifestyle. The actual acupuncture portion was much more enjoyable and relaxing than I anticipated. He had calming music playing with low lighting. After telling him in the consultation that I get cold easily, he put a heated lamp over my feet without me even asking. When he placed the first needle, I immediately felt the tension and pain in my neck and shoulder melt away. He also used electro stimulation on some of the needles, and it felt amazing. I laid on the table with the needles for about 30 minutes, I’m honestly guessing because I fell asleep! After he removed them, he massaged the area and used a menthol spray. The rest of the day I felt incredibly relaxed, and I slept GREAT!
As a nurse, I can see first hand how this therapy can be great when used with other methods and treatments for injuries and stress. If you’re on the fence about trying this therapy, I hope my experience can help encourage you to go for it!

name: Jennifer A

name: Ken Priest
text:
I have been attended by several chiropractic services in this area and across the country. I find that the majority of chiropractors tend to stick with the methods taught by the particular schools they attended. This is not what I look for in a chiropractor or chiropractic services.
I look for forward thinking doctors who have expanded on and are not limited to what they were initially taught. In particular, I look for one who works with kinesiology,  one who is particularly focused on the relationship between the muscles not only with the bones, but with each other and the energy relationship with other factors in our bodies and in our minds and surroundings.
I find Dr. Richard Aplin to be an open minded doctor and practitioner who can learn and grow and think outside the box in order to visualize what is happening within our bodies and respond with corrective/directive measures.
I find him to be the most effective chiropractor for my needs in this geographic area.

resp.text: Thanks for your thorough review, Ken - we really appreciate it!!

name: Lorren Bailey
text:
This is a long review but worth the read.

Dr. Aplin is an amazing doctor! He takes chiropractor care to levels no one has ever heard of in this town. Let's be real for a moment, almost every who's had pain at some point in their life has gone to a chiropractor for help. The standard way of thinking is that if you could just get that elbow to pop back or to have a hip or shoulder reset then all your pain would go away. But it never works, you might find some mild relief but it's usually short lived by a couple of hours to maybe days and then you wake up and say, you slept wrong and it's out again.

Well the team at Invision chiropractic care will teach you how to do address the underlying problems so you can fix it yourself in the long run. Yes you will get adjusted, yes it will probably hurt (Dr. Aplin has a different approach to adjusting that I've ever seen) but I'm a walking, breathing, significantly less pain and overall stress less person than when I walked into his office 4 months ago.

I'll be honest, I have a long history of surgeries to pains and only walked in to this office cause I didn't want to have another surgery and my dear friend suggested Dr. Aplin. I went when I truly didn't believe he was helping. I went when the pain spread to a neighboring body part. I went even though my TOC doc said I needed surgery to fix my problem. 4 months and I never missed an appointment. I can say today that I don't need surgery, my pain is gone and the results of becoming less stressed and worry free was worth more to me than the pain getting better.

BrainTap. Google it. Dr. Aplin introduced me to it and has changed my life because of it. I feel like I have the answer to a life long question that I know so many of us ask "How do I feel better?" yes that's generic but let's be honest, everyone is stressing about something these days. But after 4 months of using the BrainTap and doing my homework from Dr. Aplin, I do feel better, lighter able to take on what the world throws at me. It just works!!

resp.text: Lorren - you're a ROCKSTAR! Thanks for being a great patient and showing what you can achieve through commitment and prioritizing your health. We're thankful for you!

After I chose not to do chemotherapy, but rather a more holistic/natural approach, my dog has done exceptionally well and has had a good quality of life under her direction and care, and she is still doing very well two years later!  I'm so very thankful for "Dr. B" and her staff!  Highly recommend!

There is also a large play room for animals who stay overnight.

name: Johanna Lodder
text:
I was in a car accident, ended up with neck fusion herniated disc, lots of pain.  Considering I never used a primary care doctor before this because I didn't need one, went to gynecologist yearly, that was it. Suddenly it was lots of doctors tests etc.  Spent the last two years with orthopedic, chiropractors, muscular therapists but still in pain, still not able to sleep well.   Pain changes you....but I wasn't going to give up yet. My primary care Dr. recommended Lions Mane and Dr Z. Ordered the supplement on Amazon started taking it, it really helped with brain fog from concussion. So I headed off to Dr Z, not expecting too much, I was already seeing a chropracter.  Wow, what a difference, decompression has reduced the nagging pain, the first morning after, I woke up because I was rested!  Hadn't done that since...before accident.  I get up now in the morning and can feel my feet, and walk normally, not like I have flippers.  I had ligaments and muscles whining and complaining, because now my hips were staying where they should and everything had to stretch.  But I did my stretches and my ankles and left leg aren't hurting like they did.
I am actually thinking about exercising again,  this experience has made me hopefull again.  Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful review and I am so happy that you are doing so much better!

text: It's easy to integrate a holistic view of heath here. The environment here feels like you are amongst friends, not a sterile impersonal place to churn through "patients".  Doc Z and staff are genuine and show they care in every way!

name: Donielle McLendon
text:
I injured myself almost 4 years ago. My left foot and sciatic nerve have caused me to be in almost constant pain since. Before the injury, I ran about 30-45 miles per week, but I have not been able to workout with any regularity since, and it was depressing. I have seen 2 orthopedic surgeons, another chiropractor, a podiatrist, an acupuncturist (a different practice), and massage therapists with little relief. It’s not that they were bad, but they weren’t looking in the right place. He really listened to me and I appreciate that.
Dr. Zlotea has been treating me for the past few weeks for a herniated disc and other issues. He recommended using decompression therapy and it has worked wonders! I don’t think I would have been able to workout again if not for him. I’m only 32 and finally don’t feel like I’m 102. I am able to start light exercise again as of today and I couldn’t be happier! My foot doesn’t hurt at all anymore! I feel like I’m getting my life back.

name: Kendall Jackson
text:
As some of you may remember, in November 2011 I was involved in a vehicular hit and run on Ross Clark Circle, in which I was a pedestrian. To give you an idea of the impact, it fragmented my tibia and fibula in half (lower leg bones). I incurred a lot of bodily damage. At one point I could barely walk due to the various pains due to misalignment. The photo attached shows how much of my skin was removed by the ground, although and I was wearing a pea coat at the time of the incident. To keep things short, I'm less afraid of vehicles passing me on my morning runs than I am to try a new chiropractor. I love the down-to-Earth atmosphere at his office. I strongly recommend you at least give it a few visits to see if his structure is right for you. It only took me ONCE.

Thank you Dr. Z

Kendall Jackson

name: Charlie Crowe
text: I was a little disappointed with my visit. Before I had done the in take paper work as a new patient we were talking about  12 visit plan. I didn’t feel that I was heard. There seemed to be an agenda other than my condition. I will say that they had me in and out fast.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review. Your input is appreciated.
Your perspective on the first visit is different than most of our patients but significant. The intake paperwork asks the patient to list all their symptoms and quantify their health complaints and instructs the patients to quantify their level of improvement over the next 12 treatments.... That is correct. The reason the paperwork addresses a treatment plan is so patients are aware from the beginning that holistic treatment is not a one treatment panacea, it's not a pill and it's not magic. It is a healing process and the specifics are handled individually with each patient.
A 20 minutes face to face with a physician is unheard of these days and if you feel that was a short visit so be it. In a 20-minute visit we addressed the entire human frame above and beyond the chief complaint plus acupuncture and tongue analysis. The process didn't stop when you left the office but it continued as the tongue analysis was performed by OUM physicians in California and THERE WERE THREE EMAIL CONVERSATIONS REGARDING THE SPECIFICS. That was a step I take out of true concern for the health and well-being of my patients but it's cases like these that make excellent physicians become callus.
Best of luck on your journey and next time find something to praise about the next person that gives a damn about your health and well-being

The staff are all great. They're super nice and professional, always explain what's going on, and are happy to answer any questions. Dr. Alex's enthusiasm for what he does definitely had me hooked. name: Leslee Gaston
text:
Okay... so I’m going to start by saying I’m skeptical about chiropractors... BUT Dr. Waldeck is worth it! I couldn’t fathom paying this much money to a doctor until now.

I’ve always been the patient that lacked commitment because I never could find what I needed. I would get discouraged and stop going after a few sessions. After visiting a few other chiropractors in Athens, I wasn’t having any pain relief. Sometimes, I’d leave in more pain than when I walked in. I expressed these concerns with Dr. Waldeck, and he took me seriously. I walk out pain free every time.

He is the only doctor ever that has been able to pop my back in multiple spots. My entire life, I’ve had one person be able to pop my back well until this point.

The staff is absolutely amazing as well. They are always welcoming and encouraging. They truly care about their patients. The thoroughness the whole staff exhibits is also shocking. They make sure everything is covered and you leave without pain. They ask after every session if it was okay. They are helpful, kind, and patient when I am confused or struggling. They also remember little details about my personal life and ask me about them every time I’m there. It makes me feel more comfortable while I’m there.

Overall, this has been, is, and will hopefully continue to be the best experience of my life. I look forward to going to every appointment (even though it takes me thirty minutes to get there and thirty minutes home after a long day at work!).

Seriously... try Dr. Waldeck. He is worth your time and money. I promise.

name: Erika Berry
text: PLEASE READ! The office manager at this business is ABSOLUTELY THE MOST RUDE AND DISRESPECTFUL PERSON I HAVE EVER SPOKEN TOO. I came in probably 7 months ago, It was my first visit to ever see a chiropractor, and was in a lot of pain. I paid like $150-$175  that day just because I told them SPECIFICALLY that I did not want a bill in the mail and I would pay whatever that day just to go ahead and get it out of the way. I saw Dr. Jumper and he was very nice and helpful. I thought that I was going to be very pleased with my experience. 6 MONTHS LATER, I received a bill in the mail from them asking me for $35. Soon after I received the bill in the mail I gave them a call to ask some questions about my bill. She began to tell me that I still owed $35 and that the lady that I was working with got fired because of doing stuff like this and not charging me the full amount. I begin to tell her what I paid that day and I asked specifically if I could take care of it the day of the visit. I then asked her if she could just take care of it for me because it was not my mistake it was the employees. Her tone immediately changed and she said "You still have to pay your bill regardless and if you don't we will be reporting you to collections." I tried to explain to her that I am a loyal customer and I just do not think it is right for me to have to pay this and she kept talking over me and raising her voice. THEN, SHE HUNG UP ON ME. Today I receive a phone call from the business and I was on the other line and could not answer, and immediately call back, and no answer. The point of the matter is, IF YOU ARE RUNNING A LOCAL BUSINESS, YOU ARE TRYING TO IMPROVE YOUR CLIENTELE. IF AN EMPLOYEE DOES SOMETHING WRONG, YOU DO WHATEVER YOU NEED TO DO TO MAKE SURE THAT CUSTOMER IS SATISFIED. REGARDLESS. If you are looking for a local chiropractor DO NOT go to this business unless you are wanting to get SCAMMED. It was not the money aspect, but the fact they were not worried about satisfying the customer and doing what is right.

text:
I first began seeing Dr. Klein for a foot injury as well as lower back pain. He was very patient with the process and tried everything within his power to help me avoid foot surgery. Unfortunately, my injury was a torn tendon that warranted surgical repair but through my recovery, Dr. Klein was there giving me tips, keeping the rest of my body as comfortable as possible through a prolonged period of casts and nonweightbearing requirements, and being incredibly supportive every step of the way.

After a short time of visiting him, my lower back pain was resolved as well. I work a stressful job where I stand long hours and wear heavy safety equipment, but he keeps my lower back in check.

I am so happy that I stumbled upon this chiropractic office over a year ago. Amanda and Dr. Drew make an amazing team and create a welcoming and professional environment. They're also incredibly personal and make it a point to know each of their clients. Speaking of which, when I walk into their office, I don't feel like a client, I feel like a member of a family. I think what I appreciate most is that they aren't here to waste your time. If he doesn't think there is anything he can do to help you, he will let you know. I always appreciate their honesty and their compassion for their patients. It's no surprise they were voted #1.

text: Very good. Best neck guy around!

name: DeAnna Hadnot
text:
Not only is Dr. Klein a skilled chiropractor, he is a WEALTH of knowledge on all things regarding health and wellness including nutrition and exercise. He genuinely cares and is glad to share and help.

As I expected, I saw Dr. Klein two, sometimes three times a week in the beginning. My neck pain was severe and was radiating down my arm. I wanted to avoid surgery at all costs. Within two weeks, the pain was gone but due to my desk job, I was prone to drift back out of alignment. Dr. Klein treated my neck and back pain but also took the time to advise me on the most ergonomic set-up for my job to prevent neck and back pain in the future. As I progressed, my visits were spaced farther apart. As things stand now, I am feeling great and plan to maintain regular maintenance visits to stay on this path. If only I'd found him 7 years ago!

On the wellness side, I have a few medical issues and Dr. Klein has been a tremendous help to me in understanding what the issues mean, what my body may be trying to tell me and what I can do to combat the issue. I've also relied on him for referral advice on physicians because I value his opinion and trust his judgment.

LakeCrest Chiropractic is certainly a place you can expect quality care and not fear being placed through a series of expensive tests just for the sake of making money. Dr. Klein has proven to me time and time again that he is in this business to HELP people. I highly recommend LakeCrest Chiropractic.

resp.text: Thank you, DeAnna! You are an absolute blast to work with --- we always look forward to you coming in!

name: Cheryl Brewer
text: Just another hack pushing orthopedic shoes.

resp.text:
Hi Cheryl -- We hate to hear that you feel this way. We are a small family business who strives to treat our patients like family, with the upmost care and respect. We have seen amazing results through chiropractic for many of our patients, but it is very true that if we feel something else might benefit them to achieve their healthcare goals (like orthotic inserts, physical therapy, or referring to a medical specialist), we will encourage our patients to seek those treatment options. We wholeheartedly believe in chiropractic care, but we also believe that it isn't the answer for every case that comes in our office---which is why we often recommend orthotic inserts, etc. We do not sell nor are we affiliated with any sort of orthotic insert, we have just seen so many patients respond really well (especially folks whom are quite active or on their feet all day) to shoe inserts which is why we will often recommend folks to try them out — so sorry if we ever came off as pushy, it was never our intention. If you would like to reach out, my email is: drdrew@lakecrestchiropractic.com
We wish you all the best in all that you do! - Dr. Drew & Amanda Klein, owners.

name: Rhonda Bryant
text:
My journey began with another chiropractor about 4 months ago. Was told that my pelvis was tilted one way on one side and a different way on the other, subluxations were present in several places, and my kneecaps were not in the proper place. Realizing this treatment plan was going to be a sizeable investment both in time and money I decided to seek out a second opinion. (Honestly, felt kind of like I was at a cattle call with the first guy.) This is how I met Dr. Drew. His diagnosis jived with the first one, but his approach was so much better! First of all, he did not want to do duplicate XRays. He tried to save me money and exposure to radiation by having by having me pick up my first set of XRays from the other place. Secondly, he was quick to say that he did not work miracles but did believe he could help me. His estimation of treatments required was fewer than the other guy, but we were still in for months of multiple treatments per week. I gladly started treatment immediately.

After about 3 weeks Dr. Drew advised that I was not getting the kind of relief he expected and ordered an MRI. Kind of freaked me out and I tried bargaining with him explaining that I had actually not been resting and icing like he recommended. He was supremely patient and convinced me to have the MRI. The test showed that I had a congenital condition called Diastematomyelia which had never been diagnosed. My spinal cord was split and tethered. Apparently the condition is rare and we began a frantic search for a neurosurgeon who had actually performed the surgery before. Dr. Drew was with me every step, answering questions, sending referrals, and calming my nerves. This condition left untreated could eventually have caused more loss of strength and coordination, incontinence, and paralysis.

Today I am 3 weeks post op. 2 surgeons operated on me for 8 hours. All signs as of now indicate that the surgery was a complete success. Dr. Drew, through his unwavering commitment to patient care, got this journey started and I owe him a debt of gratitude. The only argument that I have with him is that I believe he is a miracle worker in getting this condition diagnosed.

btw - Mel is awesome and keeps the office running like a well oiled machine!

resp.text: Thank you, Ms. Rhonda! We really appreciate your kind words!
